thread.title: Toledo Places Nine Student-Athletes on Academic All-MAC Team
thread.title_full: Toledo Places Nine Student-Athletes on Academic All-MAC Team

author: @@ToledoSoccer
title: Toledo Places Nine Student-Athletes on Academic All-MAC Team
text: Toledo women's soccer has seven multi-year selections among its nine Academic All-MAC honorees. Toledo Places Nine Student-Athletes on Academic All-MAC Team Qualifying student-athletes possess at least a 3.2 GPA 12/5/2024 3:00:00 PM CLEVELAND, Ohio â€“ Nine student-athletes from the Toledo women's soccer team were named Academic All-MAC for the 2024 season, the league office announced on Thursday. Sophomores Carys Bourbeau and Kayla Flory, juniors Kaema Amachree and Brooklyn Whitehead, seniors Olivia Dault, Miranda Sullivan and Chloe Tadolini, and graduate students Emily Mann and Grace Turski were each selected to the list. Mann earned the fourth Academic All-MAC selection of her career. Dault, Sullivan, Tadolini and Turski each took their third selection, while Amachree and Whitehead garnered their second honor. To qualify, student-athletes must be at a sophomore or higher academic standing, have maintained a 3.2 cumulative GPA or higher and played in 50% of their team's games this season. Transfers in their first year at their respective schools were not eligible for the award. Amachree, Dault, Mann and Turski were also selected to the College Sports Communicators Academic All-District Team in November. 2024 Women's Soccer Academic All-MAC Team Kaema Amachree, Junior, 3.619, Psychology Carys Bourbeau, Sophomore, 3.384, Mechanical Engineering Technology Olivia Dault, Senior, 3.946, Business Kayla Flory, Sophomore, 3.966, Nursing Emily Mann, Graduate Student, 3.664, Human Resource Management Miranda Sullivan, Senior, 3.617, Business Chloe Tadolini, Senior, 3.440, Sociology Grace Turski, Graduate Student, 3.670, Accounting Brooklyn Whitehead, Junior, 3.712, Nursing Print Friendly Version
